P005514.project_name: Land Development for Low Income Families Project

keywords.cdata: assets,Audits,banking law,banking supervision,banking system,bonds,borrowing,central governments,cities,commercial banks,Cross subsidization,deficits,deposits,economic reform,employment,equalization,Financial Covenants,financial institutions,FISCAL YEAR,foreign exchange,Housing,housing demand,Housing Finance,housing subsidies,income taxes,inflation,insurance,interest rates,Land Development,Land Use,legislation,licenses,loan classification,local government,local governments,macroeconomic performance,maturity,migration,mortgage lending,mortgage loans,municipal services,municipalities,prefectures,Private Banks,private sector,Productivity,property taxes,provisioning,public enterprises,public housing,public sector,public services,public spending,rental housing,reserve requirement,resource allocation,social services,Structural Adjustment,Tax,Tax Reform,taxation,Technical Assistance,time deposits,transparency,Treasury,Urban Development,urban growth,urban housing,urban infrastructure,urban migration,Urban Planning,Urban Poverty,urban services,utilities

project_abstract.cdata: The project has four main objectives:  (a) provide serviced residential lots at affordable prices specifically targeted to squatter and low-income families; (b) provide medium-term financing to eligible private sector property developers for construction of housing for low-income families; (c) foster the participation of private sector banks in the housing finance sector; and (d) improve the housing finance sub-sector, housing subsidy policies and the land delivery process.  Bank financed components include: (a) the preparation of serviced lots by the Societe Nationale d'Equipement et de Construction (SNEC); (b) sub-loans to private sector developers exclusively for constructing serviced lots and houses; (c) studies for the Ministry of Housing to review the housing finance sector, the level and distribution of land/housing subsidies, the land delivery process and market performance, and socio-economic impacts of rehousing; and (d) technical assistance to enhance the institutional capacity of SNEC and the Credit Immobilier et Hotelier.
